text: Edward Marvin Genson (June 30, 1941 â€“ April 15, 2020) was an American attorney. He represented high-profile people such as former Republic Windows CEO Richard Gillman, musician R. Kelly, newspaper owner Conrad Black, and Illinois Governor Rod Blagojevich. He was born in Chicago, Illinois. Genson died April 15, 2020 from bile duct cancer in Chicago, aged 78. ==References== Category:1941 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from cholangiocarcinoma Category:Cancer deaths in Chicago Category:Lawyers from Chicago Category:Businesspeople from Chicago
title: Ed Genson
